text: 409K vaccinations administered in the UK yesterday

elements.text: 409K vaccinations administered in the UK yesterday

text: but new cases don't look super good

elements.text: but new cases don't look super good

text: the only good news is that after new cases and patients admitted, also deaths seem to have peaked: <https://coronavirus.data.gov.uk/details/deaths> (the first chart has data until ~15 January), as expected, but the outlook for the future is uncertain

elements.text: the only good news is that after new cases and patients admitted, also deaths seem to have peaked:
(the first chart has data until ~15 January), as expected, but the outlook for the future is uncertain

text: looking to London <https://coronavirus.data.gov.uk/details/cases?areaType=region&areaName=London>, where we started the current lockdown a bit earlier, the 7-day rate of new cases seem to be reaching a plateau, like the rest of the country (but this is only in the last ~2 days, hoping it'll improve later :crossed_fingers:)

text:
Yep, which means we are 2-3 weeks away from a meaningful clearing out of hospitals,
so i am expecting  deaths with say at this level (1000-2000) for about that long.
